original: dang ni bsdu pa'o ;
analyzed: dang ni bsdu pa'o ;

analyzed: de nas zhes pa ni sngags btus pa'i rjes la las bshad par bya'o zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: khro ba med cing sems zhi bar bya ste mgo tsha zhing dkris par dmigs la bzlas na slar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites, visualizing the head as hot and wrapped, without anger and with a peaceful mind, they will come back to life.

original: slar gso ba'o //
analyzed: slar gso ba'o //
translated: It is restoring.

original: gang 'dis srog thob pa ni 'tsho ba ste de byas pa ni srog 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'dis srog thob pa ni 'tsho ba ste de byas pa ni srog 'tsho ba'o //
translated: That which is life is living; that which is done by that is restoring life.

original: aa ri stya'i lho phyogs su gtogs pa'i yal ga tsanda li la sogs pa'i sta res bcad pa blangs la nag po'i phyogs kyi bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du me la bsregs te /
analyzed: aa ri stya'i lho phyogs su gtogs pa'i yal ga tsanda li la sogs pa'i sta res bcad pa blangs la nag po'i phyogs kyi bcu bzhi'i nub mo dur khrod du me la bsregs te /
translated: Belonging to the south of Aryasthya, one should take a branch of candali and so forth, cut with an axe, on the fourteenth night of the dark fortnight, in a charnel ground, burn it in a fire,

original: de'i lo ma khu bas bsad la sol ba dang thal ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lo ma khu bas bsad la sol ba dang thal ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: and with the juice of its leaves, kill the charcoal and ashes.

original: yang na dur khrod ces pa ni dur khrod du gtogs pa'i thal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dur khrod ces pa ni dur khrod du gtogs pa'i thal ba'o //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúcharnel ground‚Äù refers to the ashes that belong to a charnel ground.

original: gsum pa phyi ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa phyi ba'o //
translated: The third is the ashes.

original: sol ba zhes pa 'di gza' mig dmar gyi dus su thal ba cho ga 'dis blang ngo zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sol ba zhes pa 'di gza' mig dmar gyi dus su thal ba cho ga 'dis blang ngo zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the condensed text is that one should take the ashes on Tuesday, at the time of Mars, by this ritual.

original: sngags 'bum bzlas pa'i rjes su zhas pa ni aa ti mukta'i yal ga'i khri la 'dug ste bu mos bkal ba'i skud pa sum sgril du byas nas yung bas kha bsgyur te /
analyzed: sngags 'bum bzlas pa'i rjes su zhas pa ni aa ti mukta'i yal ga'i khri la 'dug ste bu mos bkal ba'i skud pa sum sgril du byas nas yung bas kha bsgyur te /
translated: After one has recited the mantra one hundred thousand times, one should sit on a seat of a branch of the atimukta tree, and make a triple strand of thread spun by a virgin, dyed with turmeric.

original: nub phyogs su gtogs pa'i yal ga la yang dag par bcings gcer bu skra grol la /
analyzed: nub phyogs su gtogs pa'i yal ga la yang dag par bcings gcer bu skra grol la /
translated: One should bind it to a branch belonging to the west, naked, with loose hair.

original: zla ba gzas zin nas ma grol ba'i bar du lag pa g-yon pas gzung ste rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gzas zin nas ma grol ba'i bar du lag pa g-yon pas gzung ste rgyun mi 'chad par bzlas par bya'o //
translated: From the time the moon is eclipsed until it is released, one should hold it with one‚Äôs left hand and recite the mantra continuously.

original: de nas de blangs la rtse mos 'ong zhing rtsa bas ni rang gi gnas su phyir 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas de blangs la rtse mos 'ong zhing rtsa bas ni rang gi gnas su phyir 'gro'o //
translated: Then, one should take it. It will come with its tip, and return to its place with its root.

original: lan cig brjod nas zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid la kta'i rkyen sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig brjod nas zhes pa ni ngo bo nyid la kta'i rkyen sbyor ba'o //
translated: Having said ‚Äúonce,‚Äù one should apply the kta affix to the root.

original: rengs pa zhes pa ni ser por bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rengs pa zhes pa ni ser por bsgom pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúParalysis‚Äù is meditation on the yellow.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: bdag med pa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid bsgom par bya ba nyid yin par ston te /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid bsgom par bya ba nyid yin par ston te /
translated: He shows that meditation is indeed connected with selflessness.

original: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //üîΩshr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // shr'i ni gnyis med ye shes te //
translated: He says ‚Äúignorance,‚Äù etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ye shes ni dpal he ru ka'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ye shes ni dpal he ru ka'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom of the glorious Heruka is the wisdom that is taught in the lines beginning ‚Äú≈örƒ´ Heruka‚Äôs wisdom is nondual.‚Äù

original: dngos grub ces pa ni gnyis pa'i don gyi dang po'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ces pa ni gnyis pa'i don gyi dang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccomplishment‚Äù is the first sense of the second case.

original: pa ni shin tu'i don to //
analyzed: pa ni shin tu'i don to //
translated: The ‚Äúpa‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúvery.‚Äù

original: mngon bar 'dod pa'i khyad par can gyi dngos grub 'dod ces pa'i don to //üîΩrmongs pas phub ma brdungs dang mtshungs //
analyzed: mngon bar 'dod pa'i khyad par can gyi dngos grub 'dod ces pa'i don to // rmongs pas phub ma brdungs dang mtshungs //
translated: The sense is that one should desire the special accomplishment that is desired.

original: zhes pa ni snying po med ba nyid brdung ba'i gang gi @183b phyir snying po brdungs pas snying po med pa yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying po med ba nyid brdung ba'i gang gi @183b phyir snying po brdungs pas snying po med pa yongs su spangs te /
translated: ‚ÄúLike a fool beating on a pot‚Äù means that because one is beating on a pot that is empty, one abandons the essence that is empty.

original: snying po la nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying po la nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: One should remain in the essence.

original: 'di nyid kyis snying po med pa bzung bas de la dngos grub med do zhes par dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis snying po med pa bzung bas de la dngos grub med do zhes par dgongs te /
translated: By this, it is intended that there is no power for one who has taken up the insubstantial.

original: bdag med pa'i sngags med pas dngos grub mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i sngags med pas dngos grub mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one does not achieve power without the mantra of selflessness,üîΩit is said:

original: gsang sngags 'di ni med pa ru //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni med pa ru //
translated: Without this mantra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs te rtsa ba'i sngags kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs te rtsa ba'i sngags kyis so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i sngags kyi ngo bo nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i sngags kyi ngo bo nyid la brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the essence of the uncommon mantra.

original: dngos grub ni dngos su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: dngos grub ni dngos su 'grub par 'gyur ba ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Power is that which is actually achieved, which is perfect complete enlightenment.

original: bde ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Bliss is the bliss of transcending the world.

original: mi yis ni de'i tshul la gnas pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi yis ni de'i tshul la gnas pas kyang ngo //
translated: By humans, it is also achieved by those who abide in that method.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that it is not achieved without the yoga of the non-dual union of means and insight,

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor med par mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor med par mi 'grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said:

original: gsang sngags 'di ni mi shes par //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni mi shes par //
translated: Without knowing this mantra,

original: zhes bya ba ni sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: sngags ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: sngags ni thabs dang shes rab kyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Mantra is the yoga of means and wisdom.

original: log pa yongs su ngal ba'i bsgom pa la sogs pa 'di'i mtshan nyid ni de de bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: log pa yongs su ngal ba'i bsgom pa la sogs pa 'di'i mtshan nyid ni de de bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of this meditation, etc. , are as follows:

original: gsang sngags 'di ni spyod par 'dod //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di ni spyod par 'dod //
translated: This mantra is to be practiced.

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pas bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pas bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by enjoying the five sense objects.

original: nyid kyi phyir brtul zhugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir brtul zhugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Because of that, it is said that there is no discipline, etc.

original: sngags de gang zhes pa la bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags de gang zhes pa la bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: What is that mantra? It is taught by the Sugata.

original: bde bar gshegs pas sngags pa 'di ni nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas sngags pa 'di ni nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: This mantra is taught by the Sugata for the mantrin.

original: de lta bu de shes nas sngags dang phyag rgyas te /
analyzed: de lta bu de shes nas sngags dang phyag rgyas te /
translated: Having understood that, with mantra and mudra,

original: sngags las skyes pa'i lha bsgrub pa'i yi ge yin no //üîΩbza' ba dang zhes pa ni ba la la sogs pa bza' bar byas pa la bza' ba'o //üîΩbtung ba ni myos par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sngags las skyes pa'i lha bsgrub pa'i yi ge yin no // bza' ba dang zhes pa ni ba la la sogs pa bza' bar byas pa la bza' ba'o // btung ba ni myos par byed pa ste /
translated: it is the syllable for accomplishing the deity born from the mantra.üîΩEating is eating things like rice. üîΩDrinking is intoxicating.

original: chang gi btung ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chang gi btung ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is having the drink of beer.

original: sogs kyi sgras ni bldag pa dang gzhib pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras ni bldag pa dang gzhib pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes sucking, licking, and so on.

original: ts'a ru ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ts'a ru ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Caru‚Äù is the remainder.

original: ston mo ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: ston mo ni bza' ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Feast‚Äù is eating.

original: ston mo de la longs spyod pa ni sgra dang ro dang sogs kyis sgras te //
analyzed: ston mo de la longs spyod pa ni sgra dang ro dang sogs kyis sgras te //
translated: ‚Äú Enjoying the feast‚Äù is with sound, taste, and so on,

original: gzugs dang dri dang reg bya gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang reg bya gzung ba'o //
translated: including form, smell, and touch.

original: des sgrub pa po bdag nyid la mchod na thams cad 'grub bo //
analyzed: des sgrub pa po bdag nyid la mchod na thams cad 'grub bo //
translated: If the adept worships himself with these, everything is accomplished.

original: gang gis dngos grub thams cad du gyur pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis dngos grub thams cad du gyur pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: That which becomes all powers is just so.

original: de yis ji ltar 'dod bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: de yis ji ltar 'dod bzhin du gnas te /
translated: He abides as he wishes,

original: yul la nye bar longs spyod pas rgyas shing @184a * //
analyzed: yul la nye bar longs spyod pas rgyas shing @184a * //
translated: and is nourished by enjoying the objects.

original: bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis brgyan pa'o //üîΩrtsa ba'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga mngon par rjod par byed pa ni le'u dgu pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis brgyan pa'o // rtsa ba'i sngags kyi las kyi cho ga mngon par rjod par byed pa ni le'u dgu pa'o zhes bya ba ni //
translated: He is adorned with the wisdom of selflessness.

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel las le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i dka' 'grel las le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: The ninth chapter of the commentary on the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra is complete.

original: // / gal te sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yin na sku gsum nyid ji lta bu zhes pa rang nyid kyis dri ba byas pa la de nas sgras bstan pas de'i don ni 'on kyang sku gsum nyid ji ltar zhes pa la /
analyzed: // / gal te sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid dpal he ru ka yin na sku gsum nyid ji lta bu zhes pa rang nyid kyis dri ba byas pa la de nas sgras bstan pas de'i don ni 'on kyang sku gsum nyid ji ltar zhes pa la /
translated: If it is the glorious Heruka, whose nature is body, speech, and mind, then what is the nature of the three bodies? Having asked this question of himself, he is taught by the sound. The meaning of that is, ‚ÄúBut what is the nature of the three bodies?‚Äù

original: sku gsum po nyid bshad par bya zhes pa'i lan no //
analyzed: sku gsum po nyid bshad par bya zhes pa'i lan no //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThe nature of the three bodies will be explained.‚Äù

original: ji lta bur gyur zhes pa la /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur zhes pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù

original: he ru ka dpal gnyis med sbyor //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal gnyis med sbyor //
translated: ‚ÄúThe glorious Heruka is united in nonduality.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dpal he ru ka gnyis su med par the tshom med par sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin te sku gsum mo //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka gnyis su med par the tshom med par sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin te sku gsum mo //
translated: That which is the glorious Heruka united in nonduality without doubt is just that, the three bodies.

original: dang po'i mtha' la ta shi la'i rkyen sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i mtha' la ta shi la'i rkyen sbyin pa'o //
translated: The first ending has the ta affix.

original: sku gsum po khyad par can byas pas sku gsum po 'di nyid 'dir bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum po khyad par can byas pas sku gsum po 'di nyid 'dir bsgrub bya yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: Having made the three bodies special, it is taught that these three bodies are what is to be accomplished here.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pa tsam gyis ni rtogs pa tsam ste mngon du bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pa tsam gyis ni rtogs pa tsam ste mngon du bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whom‚Äù and so on. ‚ÄúMere knowledge‚Äù is mere understanding, the meaning of which is ‚Äúrealize.‚Äù

original: tsam gyi sgras ni nye bar gzung ba'o //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras ni nye bar gzung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù refers to the object.

original: sgrub pa ni grub par 'gyur te chos kyi sku la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni grub par 'gyur te chos kyi sku la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don to zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Accomplishment‚Äù is the attainment of the Dharma Body, etc. , the goal desired by the yogin.

original: 'di grub pa'am 'di mi 'grub ba'am zhes pa'i the tshom med pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di grub pa'am 'di mi 'grub ba'am zhes pa'i the tshom med pa'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Without doubt‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout any doubt as to whether this is accomplished or not accomplished.

original: / chos kyi sku'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / chos kyi sku'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äù The means of accomplishing the Dharma Body is stated by ‚ÄúDharma‚Äù and so forth.

original: chos kyang yin la sku yang yin pas na chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyang yin la sku yang yin pas na chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Since it is both Dharma and Body, it is the Dharma Body.

original: lus gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: lus gang yin pa de ni de bzhin du rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Body is the Victor, just as it is.

original: de bsgrub pa ni gang gis de rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni gang gis de rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Its accomplishment is that by which it is perfected.

original: grub pa de'i tshe ye shes ni bdag gis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa de'i tshe ye shes ni bdag gis bshad pa'o //
translated: When it is accomplished, the knowledge is explained by me.

original: ye shes chos kyi sku gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa 'od gsal ba bye brag tu nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes chos kyi sku gcig dang du ma dang bral ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa 'od gsal ba bye brag tu nges par byas pa'o //
translated: The knowledge, the Dharma Body, is free from one and many, the domain of the Tathagata, naturally pure, radiant light, and is ascertained as the distinction.

original: de yang rgyal ba'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyal ba'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is the essence of the Victorious Ones, the body of truth.

original: de ltar yang gang yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang gang yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin phun sum tshogs pa chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
translated: Thus, it is the basis of the great perfection of the nature of oneness and multiplicity.

original: dngos dang dngos med ma yin nam mkha' lta bur ro mnyam rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med ma yin nam mkha' lta bur ro mnyam rtogs par dka' ba'i rang bzhin can //
translated: It is of a nature difficult to realize, being of the same taste as space, neither a thing nor a non-thing.

original: gos pa med cing zhi bar 'gyur ba med pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par khyab cing spros pa med //üîΩdpe med rgyal ba rnams kye chos kyi sku la so sor rang gis rig pas @184b bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: gos pa med cing zhi bar 'gyur ba med pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par khyab cing spros pa med // dpe med rgyal ba rnams kye chos kyi sku la so sor rang gis rig pas @184b bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: It is unstained, peaceful, unchanging, and pervades the equal of the unequal, being free of elaboration.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: I pay homage to the incomparable body of truth of the Victorious Ones, which is realized by each and every one for oneself.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod ni longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod ni longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The enjoyment of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is called the ‚Äúenjoyment body‚Äù (sambhogakƒÅya).

original: mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mdzes pa'i skus gang gi tshe chos ston par byed pa de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul longs spyod ces pa ni rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas mdzes pa'i skus gang gi tshe chos ston par byed pa de'i tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul longs spyod ces pa ni rgyun gyis rtag pa'o //
translated: When he teaches the Dharma with a body adorned with the major and minor marks, then the Body of Bliss is the domain of the Bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la yang dag par grub cing longs spyod pa ste bdag nyid la yod par byed ces pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la yang dag par grub cing longs spyod pa ste bdag nyid la yod par byed ces pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: The enjoyment is the enjoyment of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who are truly established.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And so it is said:

original: 'jig rten las 'das bsam gyis mi khyab legs spyad bden pa'i 'bras bu bdag nyid rnam rgyas gang //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das bsam gyis mi khyab legs spyad bden pa'i 'bras bu bdag nyid rnam rgyas gang //
translated: The one who is replete with the fruit of the truth of the good conduct of the inconceivable supramundane

original: 'khor rnams dag gi dbus su blo chen rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu ru sna tshogs gzung bar mdzad //
analyzed: 'khor rnams dag gi dbus su blo chen rnams kyi dga' ba'i rgyu ru sna tshogs gzung bar mdzad //
translated: is taken as the cause of the joy of the great minds in the midst of the retinue.

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'jig rten kun la spros pa mngon par dga' ba'i dam chos rgya chen gsung //
translated: The Buddhas have proclaimed the great Dharma of the truth of the enjoyment of the world.

original: longs spyod rdzogs sku chos kyi rgyal po chen po 'dir ni bzhugs pa de la bdag phyag 'tshal //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs sku chos kyi rgyal po chen po 'dir ni bzhugs pa de la bdag phyag 'tshal // zhes gsungs so //
translated: I pay homage to that great king of the Dharma, the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, who resides here.

original: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: Up to here, the ability to understand the recitation is understood.

original: 'di zhes pa ni yi ge bdun sngags kyi rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni yi ge bdun sngags kyi rigs pas so //
translated: This is by the reasoning of the seven-syllable mantra.

original: chu zhes pa ni chu dang sman lhan cig tu byed pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: chu zhes pa ni chu dang sman lhan cig tu byed pa'i mthu'o //
translated: Water is the power of making water and medicine together.

original: skye ba bdun zhes pa ni skye ba bdun dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: skye ba bdun zhes pa ni skye ba bdun dang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang ngo //

original: mig la mngon par bsngags pa zhes pa ni chu ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la mngon par bsngags pa zhes pa ni chu ldog pa'i phyir ro //

original: ri lu sgrub pa'i thabs kyi nus pa ston te /
analyzed: ri lu sgrub pa'i thabs kyi nus pa ston te /

original: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: He shows the ‚Äúsense organ‚Äù and so forth.

original: dbang po rkang mthil gyi pags pa zhes pa ni mi de'i khrag dang bsnos shing gzhib par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rkang mthil gyi pags pa zhes pa ni mi de'i khrag dang bsnos shing gzhib par bya'o //

original: sbubs kyi nang du zhes pa ni de'i ril por bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sbubs kyi nang du zhes pa ni de'i ril por bya'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the interior of the capsule‚Äù means it should be made into a whole, he thinks.

original: lig bu mig ni mig sman no //
analyzed: lig bu mig ni mig sman no //

original: ldong ros dang / gi wang dang / gur gum zhes pa ni gnyis pa phyi ba'o //
analyzed: ldong ros dang / gi wang dang / gur gum zhes pa ni gnyis pa phyi ba'o //

original: mig sman dang ldong ros la sogs pa khrag gis sbags pa de sbubs kyi nang du bcug la @186b grib ma la bskam par bya zhing lcags gsum gyis dkri bar byas la bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //

translated: The collyrium, realgar, and so forth, smeared with blood, should be placed in the interior of the capsule, dried in the shade, and wrapped in the three metals. It should be accomplished. This is the condensed meaning.

original: de yang zhes pa ni sngags 'bum phrag bdun du bzlas pa yang rnal 'byor pas so //
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni sngags 'bum phrag bdun du bzlas pa yang rnal 'byor pas so //

translated: The special consecration is that one should meditate on that wheel of the mandala of glorious Heruka wrapped in the three metals, and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times at the time of the evening service.

analyzed: skar ma rgyal zhes pa ni gzhan rgyu skar bzang po la sogs pa yang ngo //

analyzed: sgrub thabs ni dpal he ru ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: g-yas pas te de'i rtse mos so //

analyzed: 'di yang bsgom par blta bar bya'o //

translated: Having taken a human skull, the Vajra Wrathful One, having arisen from the right nostril through the utterance of H≈™·πÄ, having a weapon in his hand, should be visualized as emerging.üîΩHaving pierced the five nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s that are held by the name of the victim, having filled the skull with his blood, he should meditate on the tip of the threatening forefinger.

original: sha med pa'i khrag dgug par byed do zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: sha med pa'i khrag dgug par byed do zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: By that, having repeated the mantra many times, he should summon the blood that fills the entire body of the victim, which is without flesh. This is the condensed meaning.

original: slar log pa ni g-yon pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar log pa ni g-yon pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyi rtse mos zhi ba'i sems kyis mnyes na de'i lus kyi nang gang zhing bsgrub bya'i lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyi rtse mos zhi ba'i sems kyis mnyes na de'i lus kyi nang gang zhing bsgrub bya'i lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having returned by the left, with a peaceful mind, having pleased him with the tip of the threatening forefinger of the left, his body will be filled, and the body of the victim will be expanded.

original: ci zhes pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci zhes pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: What? He will enter.

original: de nyid kyi khrag 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khrag 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he will enter his own blood.

original: mngon bar bsngags te zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i mgo bo'i thod pa yin par bsams la khu tshur bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon bar bsngags te zhes pa ni bsgrub bya'i mgo bo'i thod pa yin par bsams la khu tshur bsnun par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving consecrated‚Äù means that one should imagine the skull of the victim and strike it with one‚Äôs fist.

original: thod pa zhes pa ni bsgoms pa'am dngos su ste thod pa dgang ba'o //
analyzed: thod pa zhes pa ni bsgoms pa'am dngos su ste thod pa dgang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSkull‚Äù means either imagined or real, that is, filling the skull.

original: dngos su thod pa'i nang dgang ba yang ngo //
analyzed: dngos su thod pa'i nang dgang ba yang ngo //

original: sngags bzlas pa zhes pa ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa zhes pa ni bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúReciting the mantra‚Äù is a specification of the action.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //

original: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad 'ong zhes pa ni mkha' 'gro ma ni dang po'i mang po'i tshig phyi ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad 'ong zhes pa ni mkha' 'gro ma ni dang po'i mang po'i tshig phyi ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll dakinis come‚Äù is the first plural particle.

original: gyo dum zhes pa ni gnyis pa'i sgra phyi ba'o //
analyzed: gyo dum zhes pa ni gnyis pa'i sgra phyi ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPebbles‚Äù is the second case particle.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i sbyor ba thams cad 'phrog ces phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su gyo dum nyid gtor ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i sbyor ba thams cad 'phrog ces phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su gyo dum nyid gtor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll dakini practices are stolen‚Äù means that one should scatter the pebbles in the directions and the intermediate directions.

original: stan ni 'khrig pa spyod pa'i don du stan nam mal du gtogs par gnas pa na stan nam mal khri la gtogs pa de la bud med dam skyes bu bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: stan ni 'khrig pa spyod pa'i don du stan nam mal du gtogs par gnas pa na stan nam mal khri la gtogs pa de la bud med dam skyes bu bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The seat is the bed or couch that is used for the purpose of sexual intercourse. When one is seated on that bed or couch, the woman or man is brought together for the purpose of union.

original: g-yul ngor zhes pa ni gyo dum gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul ngor zhes pa ni gyo dum gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: In the battlefield is the aftermath of the battle.

original: snying po dang nye bas na nye ba'i snying po'i sngags so //
analyzed: snying po dang nye bas na nye ba'i snying po'i sngags so //
translated: Because it is close to the essence, it is the essence mantra.

original: 'di'i las kyi cho ga rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni bcu gnyis pa ste nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u bcu gnyis pa'i dka' 'grel lo /
analyzed: 'di'i las kyi cho ga rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni bcu gnyis pa ste nye ba'i snying po'i las kyi cho ga'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u bcu gnyis pa'i dka' 'grel lo /
translated: The chapter that describes the rite of its action is the twelfth. The chapter on the rite of the essence mantra's action is the twelfth. This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter of the glorious Shri Kalachakra.

original: // / de nas zhes pa ni nye ba'i snying po'i sngags de'i las kyi cho ga bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa ni nye ba'i snying po'i sngags de'i las kyi cho ga bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
translated: Then, after the teaching on the rite of the action of that essence mantra,

original: go cha ni go cha'i sngags kyi las bshad pa'o //
analyzed: go cha ni go cha'i sngags kyi las bshad pa'o //
translated: the armor is the explanation of the action of the armor mantra.

original: / aom ha na ma: hi sv'a h'a hu boo shat he h'um h'um ho phat ham ngo //
analyzed: / aom ha na ma: hi sv'a h'a hu boo shat he h'um h'um ho phat ham ngo //
translated: Om hana m, hi svaha, hu voshta, he hum hum, ho phat, ham.

original: go rims zhes pa ni bzlas pa dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: go rims zhes pa ni bzlas pa dang sman la sogs pa'i nus pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The order is by the order of the power of the repetition, the medicine, etc.

original: de gang las zhes pa la 'jig rten gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de gang las zhes pa la 'jig rten gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: From what? In the three worlds and so on is stated.

original: de thams cad gang yin pa 'dod pa zhes pa ni yid kyi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad gang yin pa 'dod pa zhes pa ni yid kyi 'dod pa'o //
translated: All that is desired is the desire of the mind.

original: go cha zlo zhing lam du zhugs pa na de rkun ma la sogs pas 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni go cha la sogs pa 'di'i don to //
analyzed: go cha zlo zhing lam du zhugs pa na de rkun ma la sogs pas 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni go cha la sogs pa 'di'i don to //
translated: When one is wearing the armor and has set out on the road, one is not afraid of thieves, etc. This is the meaning of the armor, etc.

analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi pho brang ni rgyal @187b po'i khab kyi nang du zhugs pa na de yang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: When one enters the palace of the k·π£atriyas, one does not see the king there.

original: de'i phyir mi snang bar 'gyur te zhes pa la gang du mi snang zhes khyams su gnas pa zhes pa ste pho brang gi nang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi snang bar 'gyur te zhes pa la gang du mi snang zhes khyams su gnas pa zhes pa ste pho brang gi nang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore one becomes invisible means where? Standing in the courtyard means in the palace.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di pha rol gyi mi gzhan rnams kyis zhib tu lta bar byed do //

original: 'dir yang mthong ba ni sngags kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang mthong ba ni sngags kyi mthu'o //
translated: Here also, seeing is the power of the mantra.

original: gang 'dod pa de blangs te 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mdzod la sogs pa nas dngos po gang 'dod pa blangs te phyir 'byung ba ni mi mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //

translated: One should take whatever one desires and depart. In the Treasury of Abhidharma and so forth, it is said, One who takes whatever object one desires and departs is not seen.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ngo //

analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ba ni sngags kyi nus pa'o //

original: mdung bzhin zhes pa ni de ring du brkos na btsugs pa lta bu ste mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: mdung bzhin zhes pa ni de ring du brkos na btsugs pa lta bu ste mi g-yo ba'o //

original: rang gi khrag ces pa ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: rang gi khrag ces pa ni rtogs sla'o //

original: gang gi khyim du zhes pa ni khyim 'dir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi khyim du zhes pa ni khyim 'dir zhes pa'i don to //

original: de la zhes go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhes go bar bya'o //

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni dang po'i mang po'i tshig phyi ba'o //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma nyid dang zhes pa dang po'i don las gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second meaning of yoginƒ´ is from the first meaning.

original: dang po ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The first is the division.

original: nyid ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ni nges par gzung ba'o //

analyzed: l'a ma zhes pa ni l'a ma'i rigs su skyes pa'o //

analyzed: gzugs can ma ni gzugs can ma'i rigs su skyes pa'o //
translated: The Kha·πá·∏çarohƒÅ is born into the family of the Kha·πá·∏çarohƒÅ.

original: steng du rgyun 'gro ba zhes pa ni nges pa'i tshig gis sa phyis pa'o //

analyzed: 'di gnyis ni gang cung zad kyi bya ba'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni dngos po yongs su bzung bar khyad par gyi tshig tu go bar bya'i thams cad kyi sgra ni thun mong gi tshig gi rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi lag pa'i phyag rgya ni lag pa'i phyag rgya brdar byas pa'i cho ga yin pa

analyzed: spyi bor reg pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bstan pa'i rjes su yan lag gi phyag rgya bstan par bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Now, then, the twenty-second chapter.

original: 'dus ba de nyid ci byed ces pa la khyad par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus ba de nyid ci byed ces pa la khyad par zhes gsungs te /
translated: Now, then, the twenty-second chapter.

original: khyad par can gyi yan lag gi phyag rgya zhes pa'i don to //üîΩyan lag phyag rgya'i cho ga gang //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yan lag gi phyag rgya zhes pa'i don to // yan lag phyag rgya'i cho ga gang //
translated: Now, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.

original: de nas yang dag @197b rab bshad bya //
analyzed: de nas yang dag @197b rab bshad bya //
translated: Now, then, the twenty-second chapter.

original: zhes pa ni gzhung gzhan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhung gzhan no //
translated: Now, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.üîΩNow, then, the twenty-second chapter.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Then is a summary.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis so //
translated: Therefore is a distinction.

original: sor mo gnyis kyis ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis kyis ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Two fingers is an indication.

original: legs 'ongs zhes pa ni mdzub mo dang gung mo gnyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: legs 'ongs zhes pa ni mdzub mo dang gung mo gnyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Well come is an indication of the index and middle fingers.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi yan lag dang phyag rgyar rab tu bshad ces pa ni yan lag gi phyag rgya ni rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi thun mong du yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi yan lag dang phyag rgyar rab tu bshad ces pa ni yan lag gi phyag rgya ni rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi thun mong du yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is explained as the branch and mudra of all yoginis means that the branch mudra is common to all yoginis.

original: po tang gi phyag rgya ni /
analyzed: po tang gi phyag rgya ni /
translated: The mudra of the pot

original: yan lag phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
analyzed: yan lag phyag rgyar rab tu grags //
translated: is well known as the branch mudra.

original: zhes pa ni gzhung gzhan no //üîΩpo tang gi zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi phyag rgya de ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhung gzhan no // po tang gi zhes bya ba'i ming can gyi phyag rgya de ni /
translated: This is from another text.üîΩThe mudra named pot

original: mthe bong mdzub mo rtse sbyar la //
analyzed: mthe bong mdzub mo rtse sbyar la //
translated: is the tips of the thumb and index finger joined,

original: mdzub mo bag bkug mig gi rgya //
analyzed: mdzub mo bag bkug mig gi rgya //
translated: with the index finger bent, the eye mudra.

original: sngags pas gang la de bstan te //
analyzed: sngags pas gang la de bstan te //
translated: The mantra practitioner shows that to someone,

original: de yi mod la ji srid 'tsho'i //
analyzed: de yi mod la ji srid 'tsho'i //
translated: and at that moment, for as long as they live,

original: gsang ba'i dbang 'gyur the tshom med //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang 'gyur the tshom med //
translated: there is no doubt that they will receive the secret empowerment.

original: ces pa ni mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis lag gnyis su gtogs pa rtse mo sbyar ba ni khab lta bur byas la /
analyzed: ces pa ni mthe bong dang mdzub mo gnyis lag gnyis su gtogs pa rtse mo sbyar ba ni khab lta bur byas la /
translated: This is the needle-like joining of the tips of the thumb and forefinger of both hands.

original: sor mo lhag ma rnams bskum ste mdzub mo cung zad bskum pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin te phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sor mo lhag ma rnams bskum ste mdzub mo cung zad bskum pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin te phyag rgya'o //
translated: The remaining fingers are bent, and the forefinger is slightly bent. This is the mudra of the same name.

original: de ni mig gi phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mig gi phyag rgyar shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be known as the eye mudra.

original: gang la zhes pa ni gang yin ba rnams la phyag rgya 'di rnal 'byor bas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes pa ni gang yin ba rnams la phyag rgya 'di rnal 'byor bas bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo whom‚Äù means to whomsoever this mudra is shown by the yogin.

original: de zhes pa ni de gsang pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams de nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni de gsang pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams de nyid kyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that the secret yoginis come under his control.

original: po tang gi mig gi phyag rgyas ni /
analyzed: po tang gi mig gi phyag rgyas ni /
translated: The eye mudra of the potandiüîΩis said to be the one that is made with the eyes.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar the tshom med ces pa ni //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar the tshom med ces pa ni //
translated: As long as one lives, there is no doubt.

original: mig gi phyag rgya 'di la po tang gi ming du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi phyag rgya 'di la po tang gi ming du byas pa'o //
translated: This eye mudra is named the potandi.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ma so so'i yan lag tha dad pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni rnal 'byor ma so so'i yan lag tha dad pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTo that‚Äù and so forth are taught in many words, applied to the individual limbs of the yoginis.

original: po tang ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: po tang ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The pot is as before.

original: spyi bo ston byed pa zhes pa ni spyi bo bstan pa tsam mo //
analyzed: spyi bo ston byed pa zhes pa ni spyi bo bstan pa tsam mo //
translated: The head is the mere indication of the head.

original: sa zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sa zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The earth is explained.

original: kha ni kha'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: kha ni kha'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mouth is the seal of the mouth.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi //
translated: This is the seal of all yoginis.

original: yan lag phyag rgyar rab tu grags //üîΩzhes pa ni thams cad nyid ni rnal 'byor ma'i yan lag gi phyag rgya kho na ste /
analyzed: yan lag phyag rgyar rab tu grags // zhes pa ni thams cad nyid ni rnal 'byor ma'i yan lag gi phyag rgya kho na ste /
translated: It is well known as the branch seal.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning: all of them are the branch seals of the yoginis, because they are not different.

original: de thams cad nyid kyi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de thams cad nyid kyi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúall of them.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ces pa ni phyag rgya'i lan no //
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ni phyag rgya'i lan no //
translated: These are the replies of the seals.

original: las kyi sgra'i gsum pa ste //
analyzed: las kyi sgra'i gsum pa ste //
translated: The third case of the word ‚Äúaction.‚Äù

original: rtags nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtags nges pa med pa'o //
translated: The sign is indefinite.

original: khyad par gyi yan lag gi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid brjod pa @198a * //
analyzed: khyad par gyi yan lag gi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid brjod pa @198a * //
translated: The definition of the branch seal is stated.

original: gang yin pa de yang yin la /
analyzed: gang yin pa de yang yin la /
translated: That is also the case.

original: le'u yang de yin pas khyad par du yan lag phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga'i le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: le'u yang de yin pas khyad par du yan lag phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid kyi cho ga'i le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since this is the chapter, it is the twenty-second chapter, which is the special chapter on the characteristics of the branch consort.

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i dka' 'grel lo /üîΩ// / de nas zhes pa ni yan lag gi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i dka' 'grel lo / // / de nas zhes pa ni yan lag gi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i rjes su'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-second chapter of the glorious Wheel of Time Tantra.

original: yang dag par rab bshad ces pa ni mtshan nyid kho na rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rab bshad ces pa ni mtshan nyid kho na rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: Next, after the explanation of the characteristics of the branch consort, the perfect explanation refers to the characteristics alone.

original: 'on kyang las kyi tshig gis snga ma bas khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang las kyi tshig gis snga ma bas khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: However, the phrase of action distinguishes it from the previous explanation.

original: de'i phyir gyi sgras ni khyad par gyi don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gyi sgras ni khyad par gyi don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word therefore is used because it has the meaning of distinction.

original: de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ci zhes pa la shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ci zhes pa la shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is its distinguishing characteristic? Having become knowledgeable, and so on.

original: mi ring ba zhes pa ni myur ba'o //
analyzed: mi ring ba zhes pa ni myur ba'o //
translated: Not distant means quickly.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa ni dpa' bo rnams kyi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa ni dpa' bo rnams kyi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Hero means of the heroes.

original: dpa' bo'i sring mo zhes pa ni dpa' bo kho nar shes par nus pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i sring mo zhes pa ni dpa' bo kho nar shes par nus pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The sister of the hero is able to be known only as a hero, or

original: dpa' bos dngos grub len pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dpa' bos dngos grub len pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because the hero takes the power, or

original: dam tshig mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the equality of the commitments.

original: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad pa //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab bshad pa //
translated: Now, moreover, I will explain

original: mkha' 'gro kun gyi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun gyi mtshan nyid de //
translated: the characteristics of all the dakinis.

original: zhes pa'i gzhung ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i gzhung ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the text is easy to understand.

original: de dngos grub ji ltar ster zhes pa la rjes chags pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dngos grub ji ltar ster zhes pa la rjes chags pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: How do they bestow power? It is said that they are passionate.

original: dam tshig can ni mtshungs par dam tshig can gyi rnal 'byor ma gang yin pa rnal 'byor pas mgu bar byas nas de dpa' bo longs spyod pa'i sa gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam tshig can ni mtshungs par dam tshig can gyi rnal 'byor ma gang yin pa rnal 'byor pas mgu bar byas nas de dpa' bo longs spyod pa'i sa gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who has the same commitment as the yoginis is the one who has the commitment. Having pleased her, the hero becomes the ground of enjoyment.

original: dpa' bo ni su bha dra rim pa ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo ni su bha dra rim pa ste /
translated: The hero is Subhadra, the stage.

original: de nyid kyi longs spyod ni dpa' bo'i longs spyod do //üîΩnor 'dzin ni rin po che 'chang ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi longs spyod ni dpa' bo'i longs spyod do // nor 'dzin ni rin po che 'chang ba ste /
translated: His enjoyment is the hero's enjoyment.üîΩThe earth is the bearer of jewels.

original: sa gzhi ni rin po ches gang ba'i stobs kyis blangs nas longs spyod do zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sa gzhi ni rin po ches gang ba'i stobs kyis blangs nas longs spyod do zhes dgongs so //
translated: The ground is taken by the power of being filled with jewels and enjoyed. This is the intention.

original: 'on kyang gzhan yang gzhi ni sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan yang gzhi ni sa gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: But there is also another explanation: the ground is called the earth, and so on.

original: 'dis bde ba gzung bar bya ba ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dis bde ba gzung bar bya ba ni bzhi'o //
translated: By this, the four joys are to be grasped.

original: sa ni brtse ba ste /
analyzed: sa ni brtse ba ste /
translated: The earth is love.

original: gang gi tshe de brtse bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de brtse bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that is loved, then

original: de mkha' 'gro ma bzhir byas pa ni nges par gnas su byas pa rnal 'byor pa'i sdom pa mchod ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mkha' 'gro ma bzhir byas pa ni nges par gnas su byas pa rnal 'byor pa'i sdom pa mchod ces sbyar ro //
translated: that is made into the four dakinis, which is to say, the yogi's vow of worship is definitely made.

original: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thabs dang shes rab bo //
translated: Yoga is method and wisdom.

original: mi mthun pa'i mod la 'dis yang dag par sdom pas na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i mod la 'dis yang dag par sdom pas na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since this truly binds the discordant, it is connected.

original: yang dag ni bde ba ste rnal 'byor sdom pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag ni bde ba ste rnal 'byor sdom pa ste /
translated: The true is bliss. The yoga is the vow.

original: rnal 'byor sdom de mchod @198b pa ni len pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor sdom de mchod @198b pa ni len pa ste /
translated: The worship of that yoga vow is the taking.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rjes su yul rnams las dbang po'i grong khyer log ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rjes su yul rnams las dbang po'i grong khyer log ste /
translated: After supreme joy, the city of the senses turns back from the objects.

original: yid tsam bde ba tsam dmigs pa gang yin pa de dga' bral lo //
analyzed: yid tsam bde ba tsam dmigs pa gang yin pa de dga' bral lo //
translated: That which is observed as mere bliss, mere mind, is the separation from joy.

original: de yang yul rnams las dbang po zlog pa ste /
analyzed: de yang yul rnams las dbang po zlog pa ste /
translated: That also is the turning back of the senses from the objects.

original: yul gyi dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi dga' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the separation from the joy of the objects.

original: de nyid mthar thug par gyur pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo shin tu bde bas yongs su gang ba de las skyes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba blang ngo zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid mthar thug par gyur pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo shin tu bde bas yongs su gang ba de las skyes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba blang ngo zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: Since that is perfected, one should take up the innate joy born from that, which is completely filled with one's own nature of the essence of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de yang nor bu'i nang du gtogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pas nyams su myong bzhin pa ni gdams ngag chen po la ltos nas rang gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nor bu'i nang du gtogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems brtan par byas pas nyams su myong bzhin pa ni gdams ngag chen po la ltos nas rang gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: That is also realized by oneself in dependence on the great instruction, since the experience of the bodhicitta located in the gem is stabilized.

original: de'i don du bla ma dam pa rje btsun zhabs kyi padma'i drin dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i don du bla ma dam pa rje btsun zhabs kyi padma'i drin dgos pa nyid do //
translated: For that purpose, the kindness of the lotus feet of the sublime guru, the Jetsun, is necessary.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yid la yang dag par bsdoms pa ni sdom pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i yid la yang dag par bsdoms pa ni sdom pa ste ;
translated: Therefore, the mind that is conceptual is the samƒÅdhi that is the union of wisdom and method.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas thabs shes rab sbyor bas de gnyis nyid la de lta bu'i ye shes skye zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' bas thabs shes rab sbyor bas de gnyis nyid la de lta bu'i ye shes skye zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from the union of wisdom and method is the wisdom of the innate joy.

original: gang dag las rin thang med pa'i ye shes skye bas na thabs dang shes rab de kho na la rin po cher gyur ba la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag las rin thang med pa'i ye shes skye bas na thabs dang shes rab de kho na la rin po cher gyur ba la shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that just that method and wisdom is a jewel, since the priceless intuition arises from it.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid ston te go zlog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid ston te go zlog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The characteristics of the dakinis are taught, beginning with ‚Äúthe inverted gaze,‚Äù etc.

original: mdun du na lta ba spangs nas phyir blta ba ni go bzlog pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: mdun du na lta ba spangs nas phyir blta ba ni go bzlog pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The inverted gaze is the gaze directed outward, having abandoned the gaze directed forward.

original: 'dis bzhin gyi gzugs mi sdug pa nyid du gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis bzhin gyi gzugs mi sdug pa nyid du gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: This clarifies the ugliness of the face.

original: rtag tu bzhin gyi smin ma ni yo zhes bya ba rtag tu smin ma yo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu bzhin gyi smin ma ni yo zhes bya ba rtag tu smin ma yo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The eyebrows are always crooked, meaning that the eyebrows are always crooked.

original: sna tshogs myur du shes bya ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs myur du shes bya ba //
translated: One should know the various [things] quickly,

original: de bzhin mkha' 'gro ma las byung //
analyzed: de bzhin mkha' 'gro ma las byung //
translated: in the same way that they arise from the dakinis.

original: zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs ni shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs ni shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The various [things] are the objects of knowledge.

original: myur ba ni shin tu myur ba'o //
analyzed: myur ba ni shin tu myur ba'o //
translated: Quickly means very quickly.

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni de'i bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni de'i bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: The dakinis are without that intention.

original: byung ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Arising means going.

original: de de bzhin zhes pa ni de lta bur gyur ba dag gi spyod yul ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de de bzhin zhes pa ni de lta bur gyur ba dag gi spyod yul ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is just so means that they are not the domain of those who have become like that.

original: sna tshogs nyid ston pa ni rnam 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid ston pa ni rnam 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The teaching of variety is stated with transformation, etc.

original: gang gis lam nas 'gro zhing de nas gzhan yang phyir 'ong ba ni 'khyil pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis lam nas 'gro zhing de nas gzhan yang phyir 'ong ba ni 'khyil pa ste /
translated: That which goes by the path and then returns again is coiled, like a snake.

original: 'khor lo lta bur 'khyil @199a * //
analyzed: 'khor lo lta bur 'khyil @199a * //
translated: It is coiled like a wheel.

original: ba'o ; / de'i phyir rnam bsgyur zhing ri mo gsum ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin te 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: ba'o ; / de'i phyir rnam bsgyur zhing ri mo gsum ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de bzhin te 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the transformation and the three lines are just like that, i.e., coiled, which is the nature of going and coming.

original: yang ji lta bur zhes bya ba la yongs su zlum zhes te zlum por bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩmkha' 'gro ma rnams nges 'gro ba //
analyzed: yang ji lta bur zhes bya ba la yongs su zlum zhes te zlum por bskor ba nyid kyi phyir ro // mkha' 'gro ma rnams nges 'gro ba //
translated: Again, what kind of? is completely circular, because of the circularity.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges pa ni shin tu nges pa'i 'bad rtsol can gyi mtshan ma thams cad blta ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i mtshan ma thams cad mtshon par bya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges pa ni shin tu nges pa'i 'bad rtsol can gyi mtshan ma thams cad blta ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i mtshan ma thams cad mtshon par bya zhes gsungs so //
translated: The dakinis definitely go means that in order to teach that the definite, i.e., the very definite, effort is the observation of all signs, all their signs should be indicated.

original: glo bur du ni bzlog par 'gyur //
analyzed: glo bur du ni bzlog par 'gyur //
translated: It is suddenly reversed.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu mtshan med par dgos pa yod bzhin du smras pa thob pas khyad par du bzlog pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu mtshan med par dgos pa yod bzhin du smras pa thob pas khyad par du bzlog pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of going, called reversed through attainment without reason while having a purpose.

original: sngar brjod tshig ni nyams par byed //üîΩces pa ni sngon du tshig brjod pa de nyams pa ni byed pa'o //

original: dang po ni bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: spyod pa ni 'dod pa bsten pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de la spyad pa ni bya ba ste lnga pa'o //
translated: The thirty-sixth is the dedication.üîΩThe thirty-seventh is the vow.üîΩThe thirty-eighth is the conclusion.

analyzed: bud med dbang phyug mi srub min //

analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang phyug nyid ni dbang phyug ste / 'phel ba'i sgra ni mi rtag de /

original: dbang phyug ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The fiftieth is the vow.üîΩThe fifty-first is the conclusion.üîΩThe fifty-second is the homage.

analyzed: ma ni ni ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin ba ni ma yin no sgra'i rkyen med pa'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhes pa la bud med bsrubs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes pa la bud med bsrubs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The fifty-sixth is the homage.üîΩThe fifty-seventh is the commitment.üîΩThe fifty-eighth

original: rnal 'byor ma dang rdo rje padma bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang rdo rje padma bskyod pa'o //
translated: The shaking of the yoginis and the vajra lotus.

translated: What is the practice of celibacy without attachment?  The practice of celibacy is taken up just as it is means that the taking up of the bodhicitta that is the nature of suchness is taking up without clinging to that.

original: khro ba med pa ni mi khro ba ste //
analyzed: khro ba med pa ni mi khro ba ste //
translated: The seventh is the absence of anger.

original: yul gyi grong mi chags pa kha phyir bltas pa ni rgyu ste brgyad pa'o zhes pa ni rgyu rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi grong mi chags pa kha phyir bltas pa ni rgyu ste brgyad pa'o zhes pa ni rgyu rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the city of the objects is the city of the objects of the senses.üîΩThe thought is that

original: dngos grub kyi rgyu brgyad po 'di gang la yod pa de rnams gus bas rab tu gnas ni de nyid la mchod do //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi rgyu brgyad po 'di gang la yod pa de rnams gus bas rab tu gnas ni de nyid la mchod do //
translated: One should honor those who have these eight causes of power, and worship them.

original: ci'i phyir zhes pa la dam tshig spyod pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes pa la dam tshig spyod pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why? It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the conduct of the commitments.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor ma'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of the conventional term ‚Äúyoginƒ´.‚Äù

original: dam tshig yongs su bskyang ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig brgyad po ni /
analyzed: dam tshig yongs su bskyang ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig brgyad po ni /
translated: The eight commitments, such as protecting the commitments,

original: dngos grub rgyu'o zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub rgyu'o zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the causes of power.

original: sgrub pa po sgrub pa la gnas pa'i dngos grub nges par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po sgrub pa la gnas pa'i dngos grub nges par bya'o //
translated: The adept should definitely attain power by abiding in the practice.

original: rgyud kun gyi ni thun mong ste /
analyzed: rgyud kun gyi ni thun mong ste /
translated: It is common to all tantras.

original: ji ltar 'di rnams dngos grub kyi rgyu yin zhes pa la ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rnams dngos grub kyi rgyu yin zhes pa la ;
translated: How are these the causes of power?

original: nyams shing smad par mi bya'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyams shing smad par mi bya'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should not violate or despise them.üîΩHow should one not violate them? It is said, ‚Äúwithout cause.‚Äù

original: gang gis gnod par mi bya zhes pa la rgyu med par ni nges pa'i rgyu mngon sum la sogs pa tshad mas so //
analyzed: gang gis gnod par mi bya zhes pa la rgyu med par ni nges pa'i rgyu mngon sum la sogs pa tshad mas so //
translated: The cause is ascertained by means of direct perception and so forth, the valid means of knowledge.

original: gang yang tha dad pa tsam gyis blang bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir mig dang lag pas ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang tha dad pa tsam gyis blang bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir mig dang lag pas ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Also, it is not by the eye and hand, because of the mere difference, it is to be taken.

original: de'i phyir yang sba ba nyid do @204a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang sba ba nyid do @204a * //
translated: Therefore, it is also hidden.

original: zhes pas phyir gsang ba 'di ni mi bstan cing zhes bya ba dam tshig brgyad do //
analyzed: zhes pas phyir gsang ba 'di ni mi bstan cing zhes bya ba dam tshig brgyad do //
translated: Thus, this secret is not to be shown, and so on, are the eight commitments.

original: pho nya la rjes su chags pa'i cho ga ni mthe'u chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pho nya la rjes su chags pa'i cho ga ni mthe'u chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The ritual of passion for the messenger is stated by ‚Äúthe little finger,‚Äù and so on.

original: bya rog gi gdong ma'i rtsa bandu ka'i me tog lta bur gur gum gyi me tog dang 'dra bas sa bon gang yin pa srin lag dang gung mo gnyis kyi rtse mo kha sbyar zhing bskyod de /
analyzed: bya rog gi gdong ma'i rtsa bandu ka'i me tog lta bur gur gum gyi me tog dang 'dra bas sa bon gang yin pa srin lag dang gung mo gnyis kyi rtse mo kha sbyar zhing bskyod de /
translated: The root of the crow-faced one is like a bandhuka flower, and like a saffron flower, whatever the seed, the tip of the ring finger and middle finger are joined and shaken.

original: bskyod pa ni bskul ba'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni bskul ba'o //
translated: Shaking is urging.

original: ci'i don du zhes pa la /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhes pa la /
translated: For what purpose?

original: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pho nya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, ‚Äúthe messenger,‚Äù and so on.

original: pho nya mo la yang dag par gnas pa'i myos byed 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo la yang dag par gnas pa'i myos byed 'dzag pa'o //
translated: The messenger is the one who is truly present, the one who drips with intoxication.

original: slob ma yongs su brtag pa ni dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slob ma yongs su brtag pa ni dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The examination of the disciple is stated by pure, etc.

original: dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i bsam ba can no //
analyzed: dag pa ni rnam par dag pa'i bsam ba can no //
translated: Pure means having a pure attitude.

original: ma dag pa ni phyin ci log gi rnam par 'dres pa dang sgrub pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ma dag pa ni phyin ci log gi rnam par 'dres pa dang sgrub pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Impure means having a distorted attitude and the three kinds of practice.

original: mnyes byed ces pa ni yon tan dang yon tan can du las dang rgyu 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la yid ches dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes byed ces pa ni yon tan dang yon tan can du las dang rgyu 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la yid ches dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Pleased means having confidence in the connection between the action and the quality and the quality-possessor, cause and effect.

original: rnam par dag pa ni bstan bcos las gsungs pa rje su khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni bstan bcos las gsungs pa rje su khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: Pure means being pervaded by what is stated in the treatise.

original: gsal byed ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gsal byed ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The illuminator is the intelligent one.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug med pa'i yon tan dang de ldan na yang de nyid kyi phyir mi des ni lus shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug med pa'i yon tan dang de ldan na yang de nyid kyi phyir mi des ni lus shes pa'o //
translated: The quality of being without attachment, aversion, and confusion, and the one who possesses that, is also just that. Therefore, that person is the body-knower.

original: slob ma ni rang gis bstan pa la nges par sbyor bas zhes pa ni slob ma ni de rnams kyis yongs su brtag pa ni yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: slob ma ni rang gis bstan pa la nges par sbyor bas zhes pa ni slob ma ni de rnams kyis yongs su brtag pa ni yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The disciple is the one who is definitely engaged in the teaching. Examination means examination by those.
